properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 8 at 2:37PM EST until February 10 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South
Carolina...

Wateree River At Lake Wateree affecting Fairfield...Kershaw and
Lancaster Counties

Wateree River Near Camden affecting Kershaw County

Pee Dee River At Cheraw affecting Chesterfield and Marlboro Counties

North Fork Edisto River At Orangeburg affecting Orangeburg County

Saluda River At Chappells affecting Greenwood...Newberry and Saluda
Counties

Stevens Creek Near Modoc affecting Edgefield and McCormick Counties

Enoree River At Whitmire affecting Newberry and Union Counties

Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Calhoun...Lexington
and Richland Counties

Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun
and Richland Counties


...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Georgia...

Savannah River at Augusta affecting Richmond and Aiken Counties


.Heavy rainfall in upstream river basins combined with hydroelectric
dam releases will produce flooding along most area rivers through the
weekend and into early next week.

The Flood Warning is extended for
The Savannah River at Augusta.
* from Sunday afternoon to Monday evening, or until the warning is
cancelled.
* At 1 PM Saturday the stage was 113.1 feet.
* Flood stage is 117.5 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river is expected to reach a level near flood stage
by Sunday evening.
* At 117.5 feet...Extensive areas of New Savannah Bluff
Lock and Dam Park including park roads and bridges become flooded.
Low farm areas immediately adjacent to the river begin to flood.
* At 115.4 feet...Playground equipment and footbridge in the Park
become flooded. Drainage ditches in the park are also flooded.
properties.instruction:
Safety message...never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The
water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to
play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to noaa weather radio...
local media or the internet for further statements and updated
forecasts.
